bibl.title: Anchored in Time: The Date in Apollonius' Argonautica.
bibl.note: Apollonius' Argonautica have participated in or at least responded to Ptolemy III's construction of his reign as a new era. For it can hardly be a coincidence that the skyscape of the Argonautica mirrors that above Alexandria in the year of the king's jubilee.
bibl.seg: Jackie Murray, Anchored in Time: The Date in Apollonius' Argonautica.
M.A. Harder, R.F. Regtuit & G.C. Wakker (edd.), Hellenistic Poetry in Context = Hellenistica Groningana. 20 (Leuven, 2014) pp. 247-283, 2 tabl., 12 figg.

Apollonius' Argonautica have participated in or at least responded to Ptolemy III's construction of his reign as a new era. For it can hardly be a coincidence that the skyscape of the Argonautica mirrors that above Alexandria in the year of the king's jubilee.
